1.title: Antelope Hunting with the Gunwerks Crew
1.plot: Long shots with some new equipment and new faces at Gunwerks. Kregg Thomassen, Janet Davidson, and Erin Kreider all make great shots at Wyoming Pronghorn.

2.title: Way Out There at Western Lands
2.plot: Gunwerks Customer Terry Fricks gets a chance at a big typical Mule Deer--at over 700 yards! We'll see if his Gunwerks Shooting School training pays off.

3.title: Dustin Roe Stone Sheep/Canadian Moose
3.plot: Dustin Roe is considered one of the premier sheep outfitters in Canada. Add a Gunwerks rifle and a client with a steady trigger finger, and you're going to get sheep ribs on the fire.

4.title: Wyoming Elk Hunt at 770 Yards.
4.plot: Aaron Davidson hikes Mark Cochran of Nightforce Optics to his favorite opening day basin for elk. No luck. They pack in to a new location where Mark takes a nice bull at 770 yards.

5.title: The Biggest 2011 Yukon Dall Sheep
5.plot: Gunwerks customer Tracy Valdez recorded this epic hunt for a monster Dall in the Yukon. A special thanks to Tracy for spending the time and effort to capture this awesome adventure on video.

6.title: DIY Barren-ground Caribou Hunt
6.plot: DIY hunt for Barren Ground Caribou off of the Dalton Highway in Northern Alaska. First time Gunwerks users Tom, Justin and Colton Gibbins put in some hard miles and make some great shots.

7.title: Gunwerks Shooting School
7.plot: The Gunwerks Crew is in Texas with Western Lands Outfitters training nearly 40 clients in three shooting schools.

1.title: Utah Bull Elk at 925 Yards
1.plot: Gunwerks Production Manager, Mike Davidson, executes a textbook one shot kill on a great bull elk at 925 yards. This is an early season hunt, and it is also the first animal taken with the new G7 rifle scope.

2.title: British Columbia Mountain Goat at 575 Yards
2.plot: Gunwerks Product Engineer, Aaron Davidson battles weather conditions to harvest a mountain goat at 575 yards.

3.title: Northwest Territories Dall Sheep at 630 Yards
3.plot: Join Mike Davidson on a back pack hunt for Dall Sheep. Another hunter in camp uses the Gunwerks LR-1000 to make a high angle shot at 630 yards.

5.title: Wyoming Mule Deer and Antelope at 775 Yards
5.plot: Mike Davidson takes his nephew on his first deer hunt, and shoots a buck for himself. Mike makes a one shot kill on a "mountain" antelope at 775 yards in a strong crosswind.

6.title: Wyoming Elk at 1090 Yards
6.plot: Mike and Aaron Davidson take their good friends Todd Sholly and Curt Pilcher to the honey hole for Elk. Its a backpack hunt, camping at 11000 feet! The shot is the longest we've ever filmed for television.

7.title: Aaron's Daughter Harley Takes a Wyoming Big Horn at 569 Yards
7.plot: Harley is only 15, but she was lucky on the draw for Big Horn Sheep. Between school, and cheer leading, she was able to hunt the high country with her Dad, her Uncle Mike, and her brother Ian.

8.title: Ian and Harley Davidson Hunt Antelope in Wyoming
8.plot: Aaron and Mike Davidson take Aaron's kids Ian and Harley on a Pronghorn Antelope hunt in Wyoming's Big Horn Basin. Shooting practice pays off as Ian and Harley are both able to fill their tags.

9.title: Elk Hunting with Western Lands Outfitters
9.plot: Guide JJ Lund, buys a hunt so he can chase some of the big bulls at Western Lands Outfitters Ensign Ranch in NE Utah.

10.title: Long Range Muzzle Loader
10.plot: Mike and Aaron Davidson hunt New Mexico for Mule Deer. This is a tough, public land hunt with all the guides from G.T. Nunn's Frontier Outfitters. Mike takes a last day buck at nearly 350 yards--with a muzzle loader.

11.title: 400 Class Bull Elk in the Pahvant
11.plot: Mike Davidson and Western Lands Outfitters sort through dozens of big bulls to find a 400 class monster for hunter Bruce Jardine.

12.title: Management Deer at a Half Mile
12.plot: Western Lands Outfitters guide hunter Todd Sholly to a great management deer. Learn about Temperature Stable Powders, and the Gunwerks LR-1000 action.

13.title: Cross Canyon Bears on the Crow Indian Reservation
13.plot: Mike and Aaron Davidson take two monster bears at a combined 1400 yards.

14.title: Public Land Mule Deer at Heavens Gate
14.plot: In part one, Mike's luck on big bucks holds true--so does the shot! Learn how to mount a scope in the DIY segment.

15.title: Public Land Mulies South of the Seven Devils
15.plot: In part two, Aaron and Mike Davidson hunt hard to find another big buck on Public Land in Idaho. The weather takes a turn for the worst, but the hunt works out for the best.

16.title: Colorado Elk at a Half Mile!
16.plot: Aaron Davidson hunts Colorado elk with Silver Spur Outfitters--look for a shot over a half mile away.

17.title: New Mexico Big Horn at 683 Yards!
17.plot: Aaron draws out for a once-in-a-lifetime Big Horn tag in New Mexico where a long wait turns into a long shot.

18.title: Long Range Competition in Utah
18.plot: Follow Gunwerks Pro Shooter, Tyler Scoffield, as he competes in the Vortex Extreme shooting competition in Utah.

19.title: Long Range Shooting Techniques
19.plot: Join the Gunwerks' Long Range Pursuit pro-staff as they review some of the best shots of the year and discuss the shot, including the setup and the equipment used.

20.title: The Gunwerks Ballistic Solution
20.plot: Gunwerks is known for building world class shooting systems, but very little is known about it's ballistic R&D lab. The crew at Gunwerks has just released several new products that will revolutionize long range shooting.

imdb.plot outline: Tune-in weekly for special segments demonstrating long range hunting techniques, innovations and DIY information. Get a behind the scenes look at the manufacturing processes and field techniques that enable precision shooting at extreme distances.
imdb.title: Long Range Pursuit
plot: _Long Range Pursuit_ (qv) features brothers Mike and Aaron Davidson as they take time off from building long range rifles at Gunwerks to pursue extreme Western hunting.::Anonymous

Tune-in weekly for special segments demonstrating long range hunting techniques, innovations and DIY information. Get a behind the scenes look at the manufacturing processes and field techniques that enable precision shooting at extreme distances.::Aaron Davidson
